abstract.p: Drug suspect Cathy Cummings dies in holding cell in Manhattan Criminal Court building (S)

block.p: A 27-year-old drug suspect died yesterday after apparently falling ill in a holding cell in the Manhattan Criminal Court building, the police said.

The suspect, Cathy Cummings of Washington Heights, was arrested Wednesday night on drug possession charges, said Officer Valerie St. Rose, a police spokeswoman. Yesterday morning, she said, other prisoners, at 100 Centre Street, noticed Ms. Cummings vomiting repeatedly. It was not clear whether they told guards of her sickness.
A 27-year-old drug suspect died yesterday after apparently falling ill in a holding cell in the Manhattan Criminal Court building, the police said.

The suspect, Cathy Cummings of Washington Heights, was arrested Wednesday night on drug possession charges, said Officer Valerie St. Rose, a police spokeswoman. Yesterday morning, she said, other prisoners, at 100 Centre Street, noticed Ms. Cummings vomiting repeatedly. It was not clear whether they told guards of her sickness.

Officials went to Ms. Cummings's cell at 10:15 a.m. to take her to her arraignment and found her unconscious, and she was dead on arrival at New York Downtown Hospital, Officer St. Rose said. The cause of her death is to be determined by the medical examiner.
